document.docAuthor: Turrisi, Giuseppe Fabrizio & Smith, David R.
document.masterDocTitle: Systematic revision and phylogeny of the endemic southeastern Asian Pristaulacus comptipennis species group (Hymenoptera: Aulacidae) 2959

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Systematic revision and phylogeny of the endemic southeastern Asian Pristaulacus comptipennis species group (Hymenoptera: Aulacidae) 2959

heading.emphasis:
Key to species of
Pristaulacus comptipennis
species group

paragraph.keyLead: 1. Pronotum, in lateral view, with two projecting tooth-like processes, one anteroventral the other ventral ( Figs 7 , 50 ); tarsal claws with six tooth-like processes........................................................................ 2
- Pronotum with one anteroventrally projecting tooth-like process ( Figs 14 , 41 ); tarsal claws with four tooth-like processes... 6
2. Occipital emargination pronounced, as deep or deeper than wide ( Figs 3 , 46 )...................................... 3
- Occipital emargination shallow, its depth much shorter than its width ( Figs 82 , 163 )................................. 4

3. Notauli deep, distinctly dividing mesoprescutum and lateral lobes; mesoprescutum transverse-carinate and protruding in lateral view, elevated above level of mesonotum and anteriorly distinctly overhanging pronotum, in dorsal view with median longitudinal impression and two anterior lobes ( Figs 49, 50 )......................................
P. emarginaticeps Turner

- Notauli shallow, indistinctly dividing mesoprescutum and lateral lobes; mesoprescutum coarsely areolate-rugose and only slightly protruding in lateral view, on same level of mesonotum and only slightly extending anterior to pronotum, in dorsal view, without distinct median impression and anteriorly with weak lateral lobes ( Figs 6, 7 ) (known only from the male).........................................................................................
P. asiaticus
sp. nov.

4. Wings very slightly infuscate with only one wide dark brown spot ( Fig. 168 ); A1, legs and base of metasoma reddish orange; ovipositor length 0.9 × fore wing length..................................................
P. vivaldianus
sp. nov.

5. Occipital carina very narrow, 0.2 × or less diameter of an ocellus, black; fore leg entirely black; ovipositor length 1.1 × fore wing length...........................................................................
P. jenningsi
sp. nov.

- Occipital carina wider, 0.3 × diameter of an ocellus, mostly dark brown; fore leg extensively reddish orange; ovipositor length 1.2–1.4 × fore wing length................................................................
P. nobilei
sp. nov.

6. Occipital carina interrupted along occipital medial groove; occipital medial groove abruptly shaped, from narrow to wide and moderately deep to very deep ( Figs 19 , 64 , 118 )............................................................. 7

- Occipital carina not interrupted along occipital medial groove; occipital medial groove broadly rounded or V-shaped, its depth very shallow ( Figs 28 , 37 ).............................................................................. 15

7. Substigmal spot of fore wing small, mainly restricted to anterior third of cell SM1, occasionally overlapping slightly into adjacent cells; base of fore wing hyaline ( Figs 15 , 96 , 123 , 132 )................................................... 8

- Substigmal spot of fore wing wide, extending into adjacent cells (M, SM2 and D2), sometimes appearing as a stripe across most of all of fore wing; base of fore wing hyaline or with some dark spots or extensively infuscate ( Figs 24 , 141 , 150 )... 11

8. Ovipositor very long, 2.7 × fore wing length; metasomal segments 1 and 2 reddish orange..............
P.konishii
sp. nov.
- Ovipositor shorter, 1.2–1.3 × fore wing length; metasoma black or extensively reddish orange......................... 9

9. Hind tarsus whitish; metasoma entirely black...............................................
P. boninensis Konishi
- Hind tarsus dark brown; metasoma partly reddish orange at base or laterally...................................... 10

11. Occipital medial groove a narrow and moderately deep notch ( Figs 136 , 145 ); fore wing hyaline or almost hyaline in basal half with a wide substigmal dark brown spot, apex slightly infuscate, ( Figs 141 , 150 ); hind tarsus yellowish orange or black..... ................................................................................................... 12

- Occipital medial groove very wide and deep ( Fig. 19 ); fore wing extensively infuscate, with almost complete band below stigma, apex hyaline and several dark brown spots in basal half ( Fig. 24 ); hind tarsus dark brown..
P. comptipennis Enderlein

13. Hind tarsus yellowish orange..........................................................
P. vietnamensis
sp. nov.

14. Pronotum with setae long and very dense (cuticle not clearly visible beneath) ( Figs 68 , 70 ).........
P. gusenleitneri
sp. nov.

- Pronotum with setae long and moderately dense (cuticle clearly visible beneath) ( Figs 176 , 178 ).......
P. watanabei
sp. nov.

15. Metasoma mostly reddish orange........................................................
P. corellianus
sp. nov.

16. Fore wing with only a very small brown substigmal spot, only a narrow stripe on apical edge of cell SM1 ( Fig. 78 ); head, in dorsal view, strongly convergent posteriorly ( Fig. 73 )..........................................
P. insularis Konishi

- Fore wing with several dark brown or blackish brown spots, usually with a wide substigmal spot, one or more basal irregular spots and apex infuscate, or base extensively infuscate ( Figs 42 , 61 , 105 , 159 ); head in dorsal view gently curved or almost straight behind eyes ( Figs 37 , 55 , 100 , 154 )................................................................ 17

18. Hind basitarsus 9.5 × longer than wide; metasoma entirely blackish; ovipositor length subequal to fore wing length................................................................................................
P. dilleri
sp. nov.

- Hind basitarsus 11.0 × longer than wide; metasoma with segment 2 partly orange; ovipositor length 1.2 × fore wing length.......................................................................................
P. lagrecai
sp. nov.

19. Occipital medial groove moderately wide and deep ( Fig. 154 ); hind coxa about 2.5 × longer than wide ( Fig. 161 ); hind tarsus black; metasoma entirely blackish.......................................................
P. vilhelmseni
sp. nov.

- Occipital medial groove wide and deep ( Fig. 55 ); hind coxa about 2.0 × longer than wide ( Fig. 62 ); hind tarsus reddish brown; metasomal segments 1 and 2 with some orange.................................................
P. excisus Turner
